page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO SURVEY AREA
page.content: The{Ham and Petersham}area lies to the south of Richmond upon Thames, Surrey. Most of the area is open space with discrete areas of residential development located away from the long sweep of the River Thames. The main north-south road from Richmond to Kingston runs through the eastern half of the area, linking the old village centres of Petersham and Ham. These old villages and the area of riverside around Ham House are conservation areas. Some residential development has taken place between the Wars and post War and there are a number of council and private estates. {Twickenham}is a long established settlement with a tradition of riverside uses and is an important commercial centre in the London Borough of Richmond upon Thames.
